API reference¶

class¶

class pytraj.TrajectoryIterator(filename=None, top=None, *args, **kwd)¶
chunk_iter(chunksize=2, start=0, stop=-1, autoimage=False, rmsfit=None, copy_top=False)¶
chunk : int, default=2
size of each chunk. Notes: final chunk’s size might be changed

start : int, default=0 (first frame) stop : int, default=-1 (last frame) autoimage : bool, default=False rmsfit : None | tuple/list of (reference frame, mask)

for chunk in trajiter.chunk_iter(100, autoimage=True, rmsfit=(ref0, '@CA‘))
coordinates¶

return 3D numpy.ndarray, same as TrajectoryIterator.xyz

copy()¶

Very simple

filename¶

return 1st filename in filelist. For testing only

iterator_slice(start=0, stop=None, stride=None)¶

iterator slice

load(filename=None, top=None, frame_slice=(0, -1, 1))¶

load trajectory/trajectories from filename/filenames with a single frame_slice or a list of frame_slice

split_iterators(*args, **kwd)¶

simple splitting self to n_chunks FrameIter objects

>>> import pytraj as pt
>>> traj = pt.load_sample_data('tz2')
>>> list(traj.split_iterators(n_chunks=4, mask='@CA'))
[<pytraj.core.frameiter.FrameIter with start=0, stop=2, stride=1
 autoimage=False, rmsfit=None> ,
 <pytraj.core.frameiter.FrameIter with start=2, stop=4, stride=1
 autoimage=False, rmsfit=None> ,
 <pytraj.core.frameiter.FrameIter with start=4, stop=6, stride=1
 autoimage=False, rmsfit=None> ,
 <pytraj.core.frameiter.FrameIter with start=6, stop=10, stride=1
 autoimage=False, rmsfit=None> ]
topology¶

traditional name for Topology file

class pytraj.Trajectory¶
class pytraj.Topology¶
class pytraj.Frame¶
n_atoms : int, default=0
create a new Frame with n_atoms
frame : a Frame, default=None
make a copy from frame
atommask : AtomMask, default=None
make a copy from frame with atommask
>>> import pytraj as pt
>>> pt.Frame.from_ndarray(xyz)
>>> frame = pt.Frame(304)
>>> frame.append_xyz(xyz)
>>> frame2 = pt.Frame(frame)

module¶

pytraj.iterload(*args, **kwd)¶

return TrajectoryIterator object

pytraj.load(*args, **kwd)¶

try loading and returning appropriate values

load(filename, top, use_numpy=True) will return pytraj.api.Trajectory
